Definition: Analytical detection limit.

Area of catchment (z-score).
NHDPlusV2.1 GridCode.

Cluster number from 1 through 6. All NHDPlusV2.1 catchments in the Columbia River basin or Yakima River basin were grouped into classes sharing similar biophysical and hydrological characteristics and categorized according to (1) tree height (2) precipitation and (3) elevation. See Table 1 and Table S1 in the publication for more information on the number of sites in each cluster.
Column or row headers from each csv file in the dataset.

Indicates how the data are organized within the data matrix ("horizontal" indicates data are organized in rows with row headers; "vertical" indicates data are organized in columns with column headers).

Description of the information in a given column or row in the dataset.

Average upstream depth of stream. Stream depth was averaged on a daily basis over the width and length of the upstream reach as described in Appling et al. (2018b). The dataset is from the Appling et al. (2018c) data release and can be downloaded directly at https://www.sciencebase.gov/catalog/item/59bff507e4b091459a5e0982.
Detailed description of sampling locations included in the referenced study. See References section in the manuscript for the full citation for the referenced study.

Mean total suspended solids. 5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code. For each sampling event (e.g. SPS_005_TSS) the NPOC values of each of the three biological replicates (e.g. SPS_005_TSS-1; SPS_005_TSS-2; SPS_005_TSS-3) are averaged. Any replicate values that were identified as an outlier or were above/below the limit of detection are not included in the mean. Outliers were identified using distance based outlier detection. If the set of replicates had a coefficient of variation of 30 percent or higher the outlier was identified by calculating the distance between each of the replicates. The replicate with the highest distance to the other two replicates was flagged as an outlier. The "Mean_Missing_Reps" column indicates if a mean does not include all three replicates using a TRUE/FALSE flag where TRUE indicates one or more replicates are missing from the mean.

Mean dissolved organic carbon data measured as non-purgeable organic carbon (NPOC) and reported as carbon. 5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code. For each sampling event (e.g. CM_005_Water); the NPOC values of each of the three biological replicates (e.g. CM_005_OCN-1; CM_005_OCN-2; CM_005_OCN-3) are averaged. Any replicate values that were identified as an outlier or were above/below the limit of detection are not included in the mean. Outliers were identified using distance based outlier detection. If the set of replicates had a coefficient of variation of 30 percent or higher; the outlier was identified by calculating the distance between each of the replicates. The replicate with the highest distance to the other two replicates was flagged as an outlier. The "Mean_Missing_Reps" column indicates if a mean does not include all three replicates using a TRUE/FALSE flag where TRUE indicates one or more replicates are missing from the mean.

Mean dissolved inorganic carbon reported as carbon. 5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code. For each sampling event (e.g. SPS_005_DIC) the NPOC values of each of the three biological replicates (e.g. SPS_005_DIC-1; SPS_005_DIC-2; SPS_005_DIC-3) are averaged. Any replicate values that were identified as an outlier or were above/below the limit of detection are not included in the mean. Outliers were identified using distance based outlier detection. If the set of replicates had a coefficient of variation of 30 percent or higher the outlier was identified by calculating the distance between each of the replicates. The replicate with the highest distance to the other two replicates was flagged as an outlier. The "Mean_Missing_Reps" column indicates if a mean does not include all three replicates using a TRUE/FALSE flag where TRUE indicates one or more replicates are missing from the mean.

Mean nitrate reported as nitrate (rather than as nitrogen). 5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code. For each sampling event (e.g. SPS_005_ION) the NPOC values of each of the three biological replicates (e.g. SPS_005_ION-1; SPS_005_ION-2; SPS_005_ION-3) are averaged. Any replicate values that were identified as an outlier or were above/below the limit of detection are not included in the mean. Outliers were identified using distance based outlier detection. If the set of replicates had a coefficient of variation of 30 percent or higher the outlier was identified by calculating the distance between each of the replicates. The replicate with the highest distance to the other two replicates was flagged as an outlier. The "Mean_Missing_Reps" column indicates if a mean does not include all three replicates using a TRUE/FALSE flag where TRUE indicates one or more replicates are missing from the mean.
Indication of whether all replicates (reps) are included in the calculation of the mean (with a FALSE flag) or all replicates are not included (with a TRUE flag).

Site data source for StreamPULSE sites. The data are from the StreamPULSE dataset as described in Bernhardt et al. (2022) and can be downloaded directly at  https://data.streampulse.org/download_bulk.
Merged sample name (corresponds to one site with three biological reps that have been merged) with rows representing peak intensities reflected as presence absence.
ESS-DIVE Reporting Format or other standard applied to the data file.

Modified Strahler stream order. Stream order in the NHDPlusV2 stream database is a modified version of Strahler stream order that is calculated using an algorithm that takes flow splits in the network into consideration.
Mean temperature from miniDOT 1.
Normalized root mean square error (NRMSE) for the linear regression of miniDOT 1 temperature data against time.
The range of temperature from miniDOT 1 of 3 (maximum value minus the minimum value).
The root mean square error (RMSE) for the linear regression of miniDOT 1 temperature data against time.
R-squared value for the linear regression of miniDOT 1 temperature data against time.
Slope of the line for the linear regression of miniDOT 1 temperature sample data against time.
Mean temperature from miniDOT 2.

R-squared value for the linear regression of miniDOT 3 temperature data against time.
Slope of the line for the linear regression of miniDOT 3 temperature sample data against time.
Water temperature. Mean of MiniDOT sensor time series temperature data for individual incubation replicates and averaged over three miniDOTs.
Indicates whether the header is a column header or row header.
Total drainage area upstream from site.

Daily reach-averaged ecosystem respiration rate (ERtot) data in original areal units predicted using streamMetabolizer as described in Appling et al. (2018b; 2018c). The dataset is from the Appling et al. (2018c) data release and can be downloaded directly at https://www.sciencebase.gov/catalog/item/59bff507e4b091459a5e0982.

Mean daily reach-averaged ecosystem respiration rate (ERtot) in volumetric units. Mean ERtot in volumetric units were calculated for the 356 rivers and streams in the Appling et al. (2018b; 2018c) dataset by multiplying predicted ERtot (in original areal units) by river depth for each daily observation; summing new ERtot daily values (in volumetric units) for each site; and dividing the sum by the number of observations for each site.
Total number of organic matter (OM) biochemical transformations in each sample.

Unit of measurement that applies to a given column or row in the data package.
Basis of the units listed in the column.
Water column respiration (ERwc; this study). Slope of the line for the linear regression of miniDOT dissolved oxygen sample data against time and averaged for three miniDOTs.

Published literature values of water column respiration rates (ERwc) for 25 rivers and streams across the conterminous United States and the Amazon River Basin. The data and detailed methods for calculating ERwc for each site are provided in Table 2 and further described in the manuscript.
